questions.question: What is the process by which plants make their own food?
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis is the process where plants use sunlight to make glucose from carbon dioxide and water.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: Which of these is a magnetic material?
questions.explanation: Iron is a magnetic material that can be attracted to magnets.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: What is the name of the force that pulls objects towards the Earth?
questions.explanation: Gravity is the force that pulls objects towards the center of the Earth.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: Which part of a plant absorbs water and minerals from the soil?
questions.explanation: Roots absorb water and minerals from the soil for the plant.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: What is the normal body temperature of a healthy human in Celsius?
questions.explanation: The normal human body temperature is approximately 37°C.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: Which state of matter has a fixed volume but no fixed shape?
questions.explanation: Liquids have a fixed volume but take the shape of their container.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: What is the main function of red blood cells?
questions.explanation: Red blood cells carry oxygen around the body.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is called the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: What type of energy is stored in food?
questions.explanation: Food stores chemical energy which is released during digestion.
questions.subject: Science

questions.question: What is the process of changing from a liquid to a gas called?
questions.explanation: Evaporation is the process where a liquid changes into a gas.
questions.subject: Science

feedbackRanges.message: Keep practicing your science! Focus on understanding basic concepts.
Good effort! You're showing good understanding of scientific concepts.
Excellent work! You've demonstrated strong scientific knowledge.
